thread.title: Town of Breckenridge, Vail Resorts reach lift-ticket tax accord
thread.title_full: Town of Breckenridge, Vail Resorts reach lift-ticket tax accord

author: Ben Miller
title: Town of Breckenridge, Vail Resorts reach lift-ticket tax accord
text:
David Shankbone | Wikimedia The town of Breckenridge and Vail Resorts have reached a compromise on a lift ticket tax… more The town of Breckenridge and Vail Resorts Inc. have reached a compromise deal regarding a lift-ticket tax to fund transit improvements in the town. If voters approve the plan in November, a 4.5 percent tax would be added to lift tickets at Breckenridge, which would raise at least $3.5 million for transit improvements. The tax would add about $6 to a Breckenridge lift ticket. The Denver Post reported the compromise was reached after the tax plan excluded taxes on Vail's Epic Pass, which also includes skiing at Vail Resorts' (NYSE: MTN) other Colorado resorts. “In the spirit of compromise, the council felt this amount would be adequate to begin to work on the much needed improvements for this vital issue for our community,” said Breckenridge Mayor John Warner , in a statement. Ben Miller contributes to the Denver Business Journal and compiles the Morning Edition email newsletter.
